questions.question_text:
Evaluate the following SQL statement:
SQL> SELECT cust_id, cust_last_name "Last Name"

FROM customers -

WHERE country_id = 10 -

UNION -
SELECT cust_id CUST_NO, cust_last_name

FROM customers -
WHERE country_id = 30;
Which ORDER BY clause are valid for the above query? (Choose all that apply.)
questions.answer_description:
Using the ORDER BY Clause in Set Operations
- The ORDER BY clause can appear only once at the end of the compound query.
- Component queries cannot have individual ORDER BY clauses.
- The ORDER BY clause recognizes only the columns of the first SELECT query.
- By default, the first column of the first SELECT query is used to sort the output in an ascending order.

discussion.content: why D is correct answer ? it is colum alias

comments.content:
The ORDER BY clause recognizes only the columns of the first SELECT query.
So you can use column alias whet it used in first query.

choices.B: It returns an error because the BETWEEN operator cannot be used in the HAVING clause.
choices.C: It returns an error because WHERE and HAVING clauses cannot be used in the same SELECT statement.
choices.D: It returns an error because WHERE and HAVING clauses cannot be used to apply conditions on the same column. A

discussion.content: Why D is correct? I think the correct answer is C, because Having claus in this case perform the same operation like where clause. Is it right? Could someone give explanation?
i think C is correct answer

choices.D: statement 1 and statement 2 execute successfully and give a different output
choices.B: statement 2 gives an error, statement 1 executes successfully
choices.C: statement 1 and statement 2 execute successfully and give the same output
choices.A: statement 1 gives an error, statement 2 executes successfully

questions.question_text:
Examine the structure and data of the CUSTJTRANS table:

CUSTJRANS -

Name Null? Type -
CUSTNO NOT NULL CHAR(2) TRANSDATE DATE TRANSAMT NUMBER(6.2) CUSTNO TRANSDATE TRANSAMT
11 01-JAN-07 1000
22 01-FEB-07 2000
33 01-MAR-07 3000
Dates are stored in the default date format dd-mon-rr in the CUSTJTRANS table. Which three SQL statements would execute successfully? (Choose three.)

choices.C: SELECT transamt FROM custjrans WHERE custno > '11':
choices.E: SELECT custno - 'A' FROM custjrans WHERE transamt > 2000:

discussion.content: i cant understand why D is correct and B is wrong, someone who understands please explain

questions.question_text:
Examine the structure and data in the PRIC E_LIST table: Name Null? Type
------------ ------------- -------------------
PROD_D NOT NULL NUMBER(3)
PROD_PRICE VARCHAR2(10)

PROD_ID PROD PRICE -
----------- ------------------------
100 $234.55
101 $6, 509.75
102 $1, 234
in the same format as the PROD_PRICE. Which SQL statement would give the required result?

comments.content:
Oh no. C is wrong, to_number() cant use $ in format
The correct answer is B

B is corect answer
